author: eth2_bridge_bot
content: @protolambda does nethermind have an eth2 client now?

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**protolambda**
@JonnyRhea You missed the call? They are a little bit out of the loop still, but working on a client yes. They are looking to wrap a networking stack. Maybe you can give them some pointers on what wrapping Rust libp2p was like with Mothra?

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content: **JonnyRhea** (in reply to **protolambda**)

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content: ya I missed the beginning.  for sure, happy to help those guys.

author: protolambda
content: <@!467641904247341067> <@!489256758989029405> Jonny ventured out and wrapped rust-libp2p earlier in Java, before Artemis moved to jvm-libp2p from Harmony, and if you still plan on Rust (You said C# integrates Rust well?), Jonny can share what it's like. And <@!498009160982724610> may also be able to help, he builds and maintains the rust-libp2p stack for lighthouse.

ya he can ping me anytime.

author: eth2_bridge_bot
content:
**JonnyRhea**
https://github.com/jrhea/mothra

it needs to be updated to the latest version of <@498009160982724610>'s fork and the rust plumbing code probably needs a some refactoring at some point, but it is a good starting point.  steal it, fork it, add dot net bindings to the repo.... whatever you want.  might be nice to use it as a central place to maintain bindings.  we could transfer it from my personal github account to somewhere else.

I might have some cycles to add the dot net bindings for you
